description:
On June 28, 2020, Eritrea's Ministry of Health issued Guidelines on Partial Reopening of Schools. In this respect:

1) Eleventh Grade students all over the country will resume their studies on 6 July in order to complete unfinished portions in the current academic year.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education

description:
On June 28, 2020, the Eritrean Ministry of Health issued Guidelines on partial reopening of schools. In this respect:

2) All College students will resume their studies on 13 July so as to complete the remaining portions scheduled for the current academic year.

description:
On June 28, 2020, the Eritrean Ministry of Health issued Guidelines on partial reopening of schools. In this respect:

3) All students in the remaining grades (kindergarten, primary school, middle school) will resume their studies at the end of August in view of the harsh climate and rainy season in many parts of the country. They will then proceed to the next academic year.

description: In view of the potential gravity of the situation, on March 11, the Ministry of Health urges all nationals and foreigners who may have plans to travel to, and from Eritrea, to postpone their plans on their own volition.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: In view of the potential gravity of the situation, on March 11, the Ministry of Health urges all nationals and foreigners who may have plans to travel to, and from Eritrea, to postpone their plans on their own volition. UPDATE: The original policy was the urging against flight to and from Eritrea. On 16th March, 2020, the MoH issued additional guidelines to fully restrict travel from, and to, Eritrea except in urgent and unavoidable circumstances.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 23rd 2020, the MoH issues additional guidelines in which includes that All Eritrean nationals living abroad are urged to take all necessary precautionary measures for their own safety, the safety of their families as well as the Eritrean communities.  They should also refrain from travelling to Eritrea.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all commercial passenger flights to and from Eritrea will not be allowed from midnight today, (25 March 2020). The ban will remain effective for two weeks until further review.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all commercial passenger flights to and from Eritrea will not be allowed from midnight today, (25 March 2020). The ban will remain effective for two weeks until further review. UPDATE: The original suspension, issued on the 25th of March by the MoH,  of commercial flights to and from the country for two weeks has been extended. On the 8th of April, it was announced that in accordance with Article 11 of the guidelines of the High Level Task Force on COVID-19 Article 1, it will be extended for 21 days. However, it is still currently in place until further notice.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The ruler of Eritrea, Isaias Afeworki, has refused the COVID-19 supplies donated by the Chinese billionaire Jack Ma and his Alibaba Group. The plane carrying the goods was not authorized to land in Eritrea and returned to where it came without delivering the intended goods
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May the 17th, the Ministry of Health begun the first phase of the random and extensive testing to gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country. It was was carried out in several sections of Asmara and will include towns and villages in border areas, as well as front-line employees in the Ministry of Health and other relevant institutions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 16 May, 2020, the High-Level Task Force on COVID-19 announced that the Government of Eritrea has decided for the launching of random and extensive testing to gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country in a comprehensive and more reliable manner. On May 17, the first phase was carried out in several sections of Asmara. The first phase was completed on June 2nd, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should refrain from internal as well as foreign travel unless this is for extremely urgent and unavoidable purposes from the 16th March 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should avoid non-essential movement within the city or village of residence as well as travel to other places inside the country. Every person should likewise avoid travel by bus, mini-bus and taxis unless in emergencies from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that every person should refrain from internal as well as foreign travel unless this is for extremely urgent and unavoidable purposes from the 16th March 2020 onwards. UPDATE: From the 23rd March 2020 non-essential movement within the city or village of residence as well as travel to other places inside the country was banned. This order will stay in place until the necessary comprehensive review and appraisal is finalized, the Guidelines in force for the last two months will be eased incrementally.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all public transport vehicles - buses, minibuses and taxis – in all the cities will stop services from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, March 27th.  Use of trucks for public transport is illicit and punishable by law. With the exception of those who may be granted special permit by the competent authority in urgent circumstances, all public transport services from one Region to another, or from one city to another, will likewise be stopped from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, 27 March 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On December the 21st, Eritrea's High Level Task Force on COVID-19 is issuing the following new Guidelines:

1.    Movement of all citizens will be restricted except in cases of indispensable developmental, service and security tasks that are authorized by the respective competent bodies.

2.    Travel from one village/city to another village/city in the country will be banned.

3.    With the exception of those given specific permits, the use of private cars and other individual means of transport will not be allowed in this period.  Trucks are exempted from this restriction for tasks limited to freight services only.

These guidelines will be effective from Tuesday morning, December 22nd onwards. These Guidelines will be assessed periodically in a comprehensive manner and relaxed depending on the trajectory and threat of the COVID-19 pandemic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of April 2, Eritrea is imposing a 21-day stay-at-home order on all its citizens and no citizens in the country. This will be till further notice.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announced on April 1 that, as of April 2, members of a household, not exceeding two at a time, are allowed to go out from their homes to buy essential food items during the day. This conditional permission also holds for emergency medical treatment. With the exception of citizens employed in institutions that will continue their functions, all other individuals confined to their homes are not allowed to use their private cars during this period.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that members of a household, not exceeding two at a time, are allowed to go out from their homes to buy essential food items during the day. This conditional permission also holds for emergency medical treatment. With the exception of citizens employed in institutions that will continue their functions, all other individuals confined to their homes are not allowed to use their private cars during this period. UPDATE: Issued on April 22, the Government of Eritrea announces that the Guidelines in place since April 2 will remain in force while the spread of COVID-19 will continue to be assessed comprehensively.

Eritrea is enforcing a 21-day stay-at-home order on all its citizens and no citizens in the country. This will be till further notice. UPDATE: Issued on April 22, the Government of Eritrea announces that the Guidelines in place since April 2 will remain in force while the spread of COVID-19 will continue to be assessed comprehensively.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that stringent legal measures will be taken on all individuals and commercial enterprises that engage in hoarding and speculative price hikes by misconstruing the precautionary measures that are being taken to safeguard the safety of the Eritrean people and the country from the 23rd March 2020 onwards.
type_text: The policy announces that legal measures will be taken against all individuals and commercial enterprises that engage in hoarding and speculative price hikes by misconstruing the precautionary measures.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that payment of electricity, water and telephone household bills will be postponed from 30th March 2020 onwards.
type_text: Payment of electricity, water and telephone household bills will be postponed.

description: Rights groups call on government to release detainees amid fears of a coronavirus outbreak.
type_text: Rights groups call on government to release other detainees amid fears of a coronavirus outbreak.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Diaspora contributions pouring in Eritrea in attempt to fight the Covid 19.
type_text: Diaspora contributions to Eritrea to assist in the fight against Corona Virus
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Nationals inside the country and abroad contributed over 10 million Nakfa, 130 thousand Euro and various material support to augment the COVID-19 National Fund,

description: On March 11, 2020, The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that continuous sensitization campaigns will be disseminated through the various local media outlets in order to provide timely and full information to the general public. These announcements must be followed with due diligence.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announced on the 11th March 2020 that all visitors who originate directly from, or who have transited through, China, Italy, South Korea and Iran will be quarantined for 14 days in a local hospital.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: The Eritrean Ministry of Health issues on the 23rd of March, 2020, that cinemas and night-clubs will remain closed until further notice.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that bars, restaurants, cafés and other service outlets that cater to sizeable clients will be closed for 14 days from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, 31st March 2020. All employees of these enterprises will not be laid off and their full salary for  the period in question will be borne by the employer. Essential enterprises, banks, pharmacies, groceries and outlets for other necessary consumer goods will remain open.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all trading activities and transactions will be banned in this period (21 days). Similarly, weekly markets that occur in various parts of the country will remain closed.  Food production, supply and processing enterprises as well as grocery stores, pharmacies and banks will however continue to provide services. These institutions will close at 8:00 pm every evening. Major productive and service sectors (manufacturing, food processing, construction, Trucking etc.) will continue their functions. Citizens in the rural areas engaged in farming and animal husbandry will continue to engage in their vital developmental tasks. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions, from 2nd April 2020 onwards.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On April 1, 2020, The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all trading activities and transactions will be banned in this 21-day period. Similarly, weekly markets that occur in various parts of the country will remain closed.  Food production, supply and processing enterprises as well as grocery stores, pharmacies and banks will however continue to provide services. These institutions will close at 8:00 pm every evening. Major productive and service sectors (manufacturing, food processing, construction, Trucking etc.) will continue their functions. Citizens in the rural areas engaged in farming and animal husbandry will continue to engage in their vital developmental tasks. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions, from 2nd April 2020 onwards. UPDATE: The original policy that was set to last until April 22, 2020, it will remain in force while the spread of COVID-19 will continue to be assessed comprehensively. This was announced by the Ministry of Health on April 22, 2020.

On December the 21st, Eritrea's High Level Task Force on COVID-19 issued the following new Guidelines:

-Major productive and service sectors (manufacturing, agriculture, food processing, construction, etc.) will continue their functions.

-Citizens in the rural areas engaged in farming and animal husbandry will continue with their vital developmental tasks.

These guidelines will be effective from Tuesday morning (6:00 a.m.), December 22nd onwards. They will be assessed periodically in a comprehensive manner and relaxed depending on the trajectory and threat of the COVID-19 pandemic.

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all court sessions – at all levels – will be postponed until further notice, from 30th March 2020 onwards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_text: This scheme involves the government subsidizing portions of local workers' wages in order to encourage businesses and employers to retain them amid the economic slowdown caused by the pandemic.
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all Government Institutions will stop routine services and functions to focus on indispensable developmental and security tasks. Majority of public sector employees will thus stay at home. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions from the 2nd April 2020 onwards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On April 1, The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that under the stay-at-home order, all Government Institutions will stop routine services and functions to focus on indispensable developmental and security tasks. Majority of public sector employees will thus stay at home. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions. This will be effective from Thursday 2 April 2020, and  will remain in force for 21 days. UPDATE: The Government of Eritrea announces that the Guidelines issued since April1 will remain in force until further assessment.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: The Ministry of Health of Eritrea urges every person to avoid, in as much as this is possible, public gatherings from the 16th March 2020 onwards.

On the 23rd March, 2020,The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that aggregation of more than 10 people at social events (funerals, weddings, mourning, baptism and other gatherings) is banned. Every citizen must observe, and same instruction is being given by religious leaders to the faithful, prayers and associated religious sermons in their homes.
On the 23rd March, 2020, The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces, that all public gatherings, sport and cultural events that assemble a crowd of more than 10 people are prohibited.
On mArch 23 2020, the Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces to all citizens and foreigners residing in the country that social distancing must be heeded to in other commercial units and centers.

On June 28, 2020, the Eritrean Ministry of Health issued Guidelines on partial reopening of schools. In this respect:

3) All students in the remaining grades (kindergarten, primary school, middle school) will resume their studies at the end of August in view of the harsh climate and rainy season in many parts of the country. They will then proceed to the next academic year.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education
